attributes.action: levy a tax on energy inefficient light bulbs so that their long term financial and environmental cost is visible in their retail price
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Old-fashioned incandescent light bulbs contribute to climate change, and cost more in the long term for the consumer. New fluorescent bulbs are better for the environment, and the pocket. We would like the Prime Minister to make these long terms costs visible in the retail price of lightbulbs. 

This would be done by levying a tax on inefficient bulbs, and subsidising efficient bulbs.

Environment Secretary Hilary Benn has written a message exclusively for people who recently signed petitions on the No10 website about climate change.

Mr Benn highlights the UK Government's commitment to seeking international agreement on a post-2012 climate change framework, and encourages petitioners, their families, and friends, to use the new CO2 Calculator.
